author: Olly Smith
programme: Good Food Friday with Michel Roux Jr and Olly Smith
method: Infuse the loose leaf Earl Grey tea into the bottle of gin, shake and leave for exactly 2 hours. Strain and return to the bottle (you will not need all the gin). Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the Earl Grey infused gin, standard gin, lemon juice, elderflower cordial, sugar syrup and lime marmalade. Shake. Strain into a teapot packed with ice and serve chilled in teacups with a slice of fresh lemon. You could serve with ice cubes instead of sugar cubes on the side.
ingredients: 20g/¾oz loose leaf Earl Grey tea,  1 x 750ml bottle gin,  40ml/1½fl oz Earl Grey infused gin ,  30ml/1fl oz regular gin (not the infused gin),  30ml/1fl oz lemon juice,  45ml/1½fl oz elderflower cordial,  20ml/1fl oz sugar syrup,  1 heaped tsp lime marmalade
